parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>TRUE: The post contains "CMF 11240015" at the end, suggesting it's likely electoral propaganda.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>TRUE: While not explicitly naming a candidate, the hashtags #briancristian, #briancristian2024, #briancristiandeputat clearly refer to Brian Cristian, a candidate for the parliamentary elections.  The mention of #elenalasconi and #lasconipreședinte also indirectly links to a political figure, potentially influencing voters' perception of the USR party.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>TRUE: This is a paid Facebook post, inherently designed for wide public reach. The hashtags further suggest an attempt to reach a broad audience interested in Romanian politics and the Maramureș region.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>TRUE: The post alleges irregularities in the voting process, aiming to generate discontent and potentially mobilize support for Brian Cristian and the USR party.  The call to action ("s\u0103 nu uita\u021bi s\u0103 \u00eei taxa\u021bi la vot!") encourages voting, implicitly suggesting support for the party associated with the post. The hashtags are also clearly aimed at promoting Brian Cristian's candidacy.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>FALSE: While the post touches upon a newsworthy topic (alleged voting irregularities), its primary purpose is not objective reporting. The strong emotional language ("manevr\u0103 a sistemului corupt"), the use of hashtags promoting a specific candidate, and the call to action strongly suggest an intention to influence voters beyond mere information dissemination.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>FALSE: The post presents allegations as facts, without providing evidence or context.  The emotional tone and the clear promotion of a candidate suggest it's not a neutral expression of personal opinion but rather a politically motivated statement aimed at swaying public opinion.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1326594138703691</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The post fulfills all criteria for electoral propaganda as defined by Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006. It directly refers to a candidate (Brian Cristian), is used during the electoral campaign period (although the exact end date is unclear from the provided data, the post's date suggests it might be after the official end), has a clear electoral objective (mobilizing support for Brian Cristian and USR), and goes beyond journalistic reporting by using emotionally charged language and a clear call to action.  The hashtags further amplify the promotional aspect.  The paid nature of the Facebook post confirms its intention to reach a wide audience.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate><name>Brian Cristian</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
  <candidate><name>Elena Lasconi</name><impact>POSITIVE (indirect)</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>USR</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
USR Maramureș, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea unei postări plătite pe Facebook (ID: 1326594138703691) după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, care promovează candidatura lui Brian Cristian și, indirect, pe cea a Elenei Lasconi,  prin utilizarea de hashtag-uri precum #briancristian, #briancristian2024, #briancristiandeputat, #elenalasconi și #lasconipreședinte,  și prin acuzații nefondate privind nereguli electorale, cu scopul de a influența votul alegătorilor. Postarea, cu un buget de 100-199 RON, a atins o audiență estimată de 50.000-100.000 de persoane în județul Maramureș,  conținând un apel la acțiune ("s\u0103 nu uita\u021bi s\u0103 \u00eei taxa\u021bi la vot!"),  constituie propagandă electorală interzisă după încheierea campaniei electorale.  Contact: maramures@usrmm.ro, +40751926939.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
